data.title: Nearest neighbors
data.solution:
import math

x, y = [int(i) for i in input().split()]
N = int(input())
neighbors = []
maxdist = 20
for n in range(N):
    x_1, y_1 = [int(j) for j in input().split()]
    dist = math.sqrt( (x-x_1)**2 + (y-y_1)**2 )
    if dist < maxdist:
        maxdist = dist
        neighbors = [[x_1, y_1]]
    elif dist == maxdist:
        neighbors.append([x_1, y_1])
    else:
        pass
neighbors = sorted(neighbors)
for i in range(len(neighbors)):
    print( neighbors[i][0], neighbors[i][1] )
data.statement:
Find the nearest neighbor using the 2D Euclidean measure of a point of a given reference point in a 2D plan (x,y).

If the reference point has multiple nearest neighbors, sort the output with respect to the first (x) coordinate, then to the second (y) coordinate.
data.stubGenerator:
read x:int y:int
read N:int
loop N read x1:int y1:int
write x_1 y_1
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>> : integer coordinates of the reference point [[x]], [[y]].
<<Line 2>> : integer number [[N]] of other points.
<<Next [[N]] lines>> : 2 integer [[x]] and [[y]] which are the coordinates of the other points.
data.outputDescription:
[[x]] and [[y]] coordinates of the nearest neighbor(s) of the reference point, separated by a single space.

In case of multiple neighbors, sort the output with respect to the first ([[x]]) coordinate, then to the second ([[y]]) coordinate, and print each point in a different line.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Find the nearest neighbor using the 2D Euclidean measure of a point of a given reference point in a 2D plan (x,y).

If the reference point has multiple nearest neighbors, sort the output with respect to the first (x) coordinate, then to the second (y) coordinate.
Input
Line 1 : integer coordinates of the reference point x, y.
Line 2 : integer number N of other points.
Next N lines : 2 integer x and y which are the coordinates of the other points.
Output
x and y coordinates of the nearest neighbor(s) of the reference point, separated by a single space.

In case of multiple neighbors, sort the output with respect to the first (x) coordinate, then to the second (y) coordinate, and print each point in a different line.
Constraints
0<=x, y<=10
Example
Input
1 1
2
0 1
3 1
Output
0 1
